intro: Ageratum mexicanum f. lasseauxii, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and is used in garden landscapes and floral arrangements. The foliage is usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, adding to its aesthetic appeal.
